top_comments.comment:
Iran knows how much of a domineering warmonger the US can be.  He's taking his risks with the other domineering warmongers that are a little closer to home that can get there sooner.

I'm no military strategist, but it's what I'd do.  If Iran stabilizes Afghanistan, Iran is a world hero.  That nation hasn't been stable since more powerful (greedy) nations discovered resources there, ages ago.  If anyone can do it, it's a local player who knows the field, and what better than one of the oldest players around?  If there be peace coming from Allah, so what?  It's peace!  Deal with it, world!
So …. What does Israel have to say about this …

comments_since_last_sample.body: The alt-reich, fresh off legitimizing North Korea and convincing South Korea that they better not rely on us in another conflict, is enraged that Iran might pick up a toy we were done playing with.  I guess for the purposes of racism, Koreans are whiter than Persians in their eyes.

I know nationalism is the most reductionist way to look at it.  But with everything that has been happening with Chinese and Russian hackers, I don't want them having any more foothold to have more influence and more power--much less more legitimate influence and power--any closer to the data centers that already control too much of our information.
The Taliban doesn't know what to do with itself if it's not fighting someone, they don't want the job of running a country.
I mean Russia and China are in the same region. To be entirely honest, I wouldn't trust the US anyway. We just freedom folks into obliteration.
